bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla } SS
To Hon E. P. Alethark Judge of the District County First Judicial District

The undersigned marked complaint To The Honorable Judge of said county & for cause of complaint of that he his now on teh 15 day of August 1862 restrained of his liberty by James Buckley Sheriff of said county in The county jail of said county adn he believed by the Territory of Washington & he is so restrained of his liberty under the pretense according to the best of his knowledge that he has committed the crime of homicide & he believes he is restrained of his liberty illegally because he knows of no legal process in the hands of said Buckley by which he can be held or by what authority ―
that they undersigned said complainant is not restrained of his liberty by any warrant offerd according to him as he believes committed any judgement of any court or for any contempt of any Court offense or other body having authority & cause or upon a judgement offense fomr the District Court upon as judgement or information or any formal judgement of any Court of competent jurisdiction & prays to be discharged or bailed.
div1.ab: Subscribed and Sworn William Kerby to before me this 18th day of August A.D. 1862
div1.p: Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus For the case of Kerby
div1.ab: Aug 15/62 Writ allowed by. E. P. Oliphant Judge &c.
Filed August 15th, 1862. B. N. Secton Clerk
